title: Wunmi Mosaku Wins Bafta Award and Shares Her Story
summary: Wunmi Mosaku is an actress who won a Bafta award for her role in a film called Sinners. She was born in Nigeria and moved to Manchester when she was a baby. In the film, she played a character named Annie, who is a Hoodoo priestess. Wunmi said that playing Annie helped her feel connected to her family history and culture, which she sometimes felt she had lost as an immigrant trying to fit in. She is the first black British woman to win this award. Wunmi also talked about how her story helps other black women feel seen and valued. She became an actress after watching the movie Annie as a child and was inspired by actors like Albert Finney. Wunmi is happy about her win and thanked her daughter.

background_read: Wunmi Mosaku is an actress from Nigeria who grew up in Manchester, England. She won a Bafta award for her role in a film, making her the first black British woman to win in that category. In the film, she played a character that helped her feel proud of her heritage. She started acting after being inspired by movies as a child. This story shows how people can achieve their dreams and feel connected to their roots.
